title: Add client editing, client name, client password authentication, and network monitoring status toggle

requirements.summary: Add Nome (client name) input field to ClientRegistrationForm for creating new clients
acceptanceCriteria: Form includes Nome text input field
Nome field is required for submission
Nome value is sent to backend during client creation
Form validation handles empty Nome field

file_operations.description: Add Nome text input field to the form with required validation. Update the form state to include nome field and pass it to the createClient mutation along with existing fields (idLuid, ipVps, userVps, senhaVps, plano). Add form validation to ensure Nome is not empty before submission.

requirements.summary: Add Senha_Cliente (client password) input field to ClientRegistrationForm for creating new clients
acceptanceCriteria: Form includes Senha_Cliente password input field
Senha_Cliente field is required for submission
Password input type is used for security
Senha_Cliente value is sent to backend during client creation

file_operations.description: Add Senha_Cliente password input field to the form with required validation and type='password' for security. Update the form state to include senhaCliente field and pass it to the createClient mutation. Ensure validation checks that Senha_Cliente is not empty before submission.

requirements.summary: Create client edit form/modal in admin panel for editing all client fields
acceptanceCriteria: Admin panel shows edit button for each client in ClientList
Clicking edit opens form/modal pre-filled with current client data
All fields (Nome, IP_VPS, User_VPS, Senha_VPS, Plano, Senha_Cliente) are editable
Save button triggers backend update mutation
Success/error toast notifications display after update
Client list refreshes after successful update

file_operations.description: Create a new modal component using shadcn/ui Dialog component that displays a form pre-filled with client data. Include input fields for Nome, IP_VPS, User_VPS, Senha_VPS, Plano, and Senha_Cliente. Add Save and Cancel buttons. On save, call the updateClient mutation hook with all field values. Display toast notifications for success/error. Accept open/onOpenChange props and selectedClient prop containing the ClientRecord to edit.

Add an Edit button next to the Delete button for each client row. Add state to track which client is being edited and modal open state. Import and render ClientEditModal component, passing the selected client data and open state. The modal should open when Edit button is clicked and close after successful save or cancel.

requirements.summary: Display Nome (client name) column in ClientList table
acceptanceCriteria: Table includes Nome column
Nome value displays for each client row
Column is positioned appropriately in table layout

file_operations.description: Add a Nome column to the table between the ID column and IP_VPS column. Display client.nome value for each client row in the table. Update table headers to include 'Nome' label.

requirements.summary: Update client login to require both ID_Luid and Senha_Cliente for authentication
acceptanceCriteria: ClientLogin page includes password input field in addition to ID_Luid
Login validation checks both ID_Luid and Senha_Cliente against backend data
Login fails if password does not match
Error message displays for invalid credentials
Successful login proceeds to client dashboard

file_operations.description: Add a Senha_Cliente password input field to the login form below the ID_Luid field. Update form state to include password. Modify the login handler to fetch the client record using getClientRecord query, then compare the entered password with client.senhaCliente. If passwords match, call clientLogin with the client record. If passwords don't match or client not found, display error toast with 'Invalid credentials' message. On successful authentication, navigate to client dashboard.

requirements.summary: Add network monitoring status toggle control in admin panel
acceptanceCriteria: Admin panel displays toggle control with 'Normal' and 'Offline' options
Current monitoring status is fetched from backend and displayed
Changing toggle updates backend monitoring status
Visual feedback confirms status change
Toggle state persists across page refreshes

file_operations.description: Create a new component that displays a toggle control for network monitoring status. Use the getNetworkMonitoringStatus query hook to fetch and display current status. Render a toggle or radio group with 'Normal' and 'Offline' options. When the user changes the selection, call the setMonitoringStatus mutation hook with the new status value. Display toast notification on successful status change. Style the component to match the Dark Premium theme with neon green accents.

Import and render the NetworkMonitoringToggle component in the admin panel. Position it in a logical location within the admin interface, such as below the GlobalAnnouncementInput or in a separate monitoring section. Ensure the component is visible and accessible to admins.

requirements.summary: Modify network speed simulation to display zero when monitoring status is Offline
acceptanceCriteria: useNetworkSpeedSimulation hook fetches current monitoring status from backend
When status is 'Offline', network speed returns 0 Gbps
When status is 'Normal', network speed oscillates between 2.5-4.8 Gbps as before
NetworkSpeedChart component correctly displays zero speed when offline
Chart updates in real-time when monitoring status changes

file_operations.description: Import and use the getNetworkMonitoringStatus query hook to fetch the current monitoring status. Modify the speed calculation logic: when status is 'offline', set speed to 0 Gbps; when status is 'normal', use the existing sine wave oscillation logic (2.5-4.8 Gbps). Ensure the hook re-calculates speed when monitoring status changes by including status in the useEffect dependencies.

requirements.summary: Add frontend mutation hooks for updating clients and managing network monitoring status
acceptanceCriteria: useQueries.ts includes updateClient mutation hook
useQueries.ts includes setMonitoringStatus mutation hook
useQueries.ts includes getMonitoringStatus query hook
Mutations invalidate relevant query caches on success
Hooks integrate with TanStack Query properly

file_operations.description: Add updateClient mutation hook that calls backend.updateClientRecord with parameters (idLuid, nome, senhaCliente, ipVps, userVps, senhaVps, plano). On success, invalidate the 'clientRecords' and 'clientRecord' query caches. Add setMonitoringStatus mutation hook that calls backend.updateNetworkMonitoringStatus with status parameter. On success, invalidate 'networkMonitoringStatus' query cache. Add getNetworkMonitoringStatus query hook that calls backend.getNetworkMonitoringStatus and returns the current status string. Use TanStack Query's useMutation and useQuery patterns consistent with existing hooks in the file.
